__e: Now, if you'll excuse me, I have to figure out a way to tell Reverend Mayfair that he's not getting lucky tomorrow!
Tell the rev I did not know it was his kid.
Hazel, you do like me, don't you? Better than the parson.
- Since the rev's no longer a suspect, the bar's got nothing to do with the hotel or the church.
Don't be foolish, father, you know very well that I'm not a good girl.
My wife is not a reverend, and I'm not a doctor.
You didn't have anything to do with the minister and the others, right?
It's not your fault, not my fault, not the good reverend doctor's fault; and it ain't got nothin' to do with the devil.
